III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth reported stealing edibles from a staff.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported she obtained edibles out of a staff’s car at the facility.
Youth A did not recall whose car it was or what the car looked like.
Youth A was walking back to the house after dinner and was
waiting for staff to come. Youth A was hiding behind a car and
looked in the car and saw edibles laying on the floor of the car.
Youth A reported the edibles were gummies and there were two in
the package. The package had the THC level on it, each edible
was 10mg. Youth A took both edibles out of the car and put them
in her pocket. Youth A reported there was nothing else in the car.
Youth A did not remember what the edibles looked like, if there
was a logo on the package of edibles, who the staff was that was
working that she was waiting on. Youth A reported the car was
parked in the parking lot by Holbrook and Leppien. Youth A had
the edibles for about 1 week prior to the festival of lights parade
and kept the edibles in her pocket. Youth A took both edibles right
before leaving for the festival of lights parade. Youth A reported no
one saw her take the edibles including staff or youth. Youth A
reported this was the first time she has taken edibles at the facility.
Youth A reported she also snorted methamphetamines prior to
taking the edibles before leaving for the festival of lights parade.
Youth A reported she has not found any other drugs at the facility.
Youth A reported she found a blue vial container of
methamphetamines at a gas station while she was on a facility
2

outing. Youth A reported she snorted the methamphetamine in
small doses over a two-week period while at the facility. Youth A
reported no staff knew she had the methamphetamines. Youth A
did not recall when the outing was where she obtained the
methamphetamines from the gas station or any of the staff that
were with her on the outing. Youth A found the small blue vial
outside the gas station near the pump where there were bags of
stuff the gas station was selling. Youth A flushed the blue vial
down the toilet at the facility after taking the last of the
methamphetamine before the festival of lights. Youth A reported
she “knew” it was methamphetamines and she had a small
amount of methamphetamines on her drug test results. Youth A
reported no staff at the facility have ever provided her with drugs
or offered her drugs. Youth A asked if she was able to leave the
facility.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B
attended the outing to the festival of lights parade. Youth B saw
Youth A falling and Youth A was taken to the hospital. Youth B
heard Youth A had taken an edible. Youth B was asked by staff if
she knew where Youth A obtained the edible and Youth B told
staff she did not. Youth B reported she did not know of any staff
having any drugs on campus.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C
reported Youth A told her she had methamphetamines from when
she went on a home pass. Youth A told Youth C it was “crystals”.
Youth C never saw the methamphetamines. Youth C reported
Youth A took some methamphetamines prior to going to the
festival of lights parade and had to go to the hospital. Youth C
reported she has never seen any drugs on staff at the facility or on
campus. Youth C did not know of any other youth that have had
drugs at the facility.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth D
reported Youth A went on a home pass and brought edibles back
to the facility. Youth A took the edibles at the festive of lights
parade and fell. Youth A was taken to the hospital. Youth A told
Youth D she also had methamphetamines in her system. Youth D
reported she does not know what drugs look like and only knows
what a cigarette and vape look like.
3

Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Therapist has
spoken with Youth A regarding the incident. Youth A has not
been forth coming with information. Youth A reported to Therapist
she obtained the edible from a staff members car the morning of
the festival of lights parade. Youth A would not provide Therapist
with any additional information including whose car or what the car
looked like. Youth A told Therapist she found methamphetamines
at a gas station while on a home pass. Youth A would not provide
Therapist with any other details regarding the methamphetamines.
Therapist made the decision with other team members
recommendations to take away home passes at this time for
Youth A. Youth A told Staff 3 the edible came from Staff 1’s car.
The facility investigated if Youth A could have received the edible
from Staff 1’s car however based on the facilities internal
investigation it did not appear the edible was from Staff 1’s car.
Therapist spoke with the placement Youth A went to on her home
pass and was informed from the placement Youth A was never at
a gas station while on the home pass. Therapist reported Youth A
has a substance abuse history prior to coming to the facility.
Therapist also heard Youth A had alleged the edible came from a
black coat that belonged to a staff member at the all-staff
Thanksgiving however Youth A did not say whose coat it was or
ever tell Therapist this. Therapist reported the facility also
explored if Youth A may have received the edible from Youth B as
Youth B had returned from a home pass the morning of the
festival of lights. Therapist reported all the youth in the house
were drug tested and were negative other than Youth A. Youth B
was drug tested twice as it was alleged Youth C may have tested
for Youth B. Therapist spoke with Youth B’s caregiver where
Youth B was for the home pass and explored if it was even
possible Youth B could have obtained any edibles or
methamphetamine. Youth B was unsupervised with a friend for
approximately five minutes while on the home pass and in that
time, it is possible Youth B could have received something and
brought it back to the facility however it is believed if this had been
the case then Youth B’s drug screen would have also been
positive for substances.
Staff 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 12/13/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported the facility
does not allow staff to have any marijuana products on campus.
Staff 1 has never seen any drugs on any staff at the facility. Staff
1 reported she has never provided any youth any drugs at the
facility. Staff 1 has never provided Youth A with any edibles. Staff
1 denied ever having THC edibles in her care and reported she
4

does not use THC edibles or any drugs. Staff 1 completed a drug
screen for the facility and tested negative for all substances. Staff
1 reported Youth A has never talked to her about the allegations
Youth A made. Staff 1 heard, unknown from who, Youth A
reported using methamphetamine. Youth A told Staff 1 she had a
blue vial and showed Staff 1 the blue vial however Staff 1 did not
know what was in the blue vial. Youth A showed Staff 1 the blue
vial two days after returning from a home pass. Youth A was late
for school one morning and told Staff 1 she had found a blue vial
while on her home pass and did not know what to do with it. Staff
1 reported she did not know how to handle the situation, so she
put it back in Youth A’s hands and told Youth A to do the right
thing with the blue vial. Staff 1 did not do any type of incident
report regarding this situation. Staff 1 reported Youth A was not
acting abnormal during this time and did not have any erratic
behavior.
Staff 2 was interviewed via teams meeting on 12/13/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 had heard about
Youth A eating edibles however did not have any direct
knowledge of the incident. Youth A started a conversation with
Staff 2 about methamphetamines and was making a joke of it
however Staff 2 did not engage in the conversation and changed
the subject. Staff 2 reported two weeks prior to Youth A going to
the festival of lights parade she did notice Youth A to be more
tired and fatigue than normal. Staff 2 has never seen staff have
methamphetamines or edibles at work or in their cars at work.
Staff 2 did not have any knowledge of Youth A having a blue vial.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams meeting on 12/13/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 heard about Youth A
however did not have any firsthand knowledge. Staff 3 has not
had any concerns that Youth A was under the influence of drugs
at the facility. Staff 3 recalled after Youth A returned from her last
home pass, Youth A did not want to go to school. Staff 3 heard
about the blue vial Youth A had and explained it as a small
keychain item that typically is used to put ashes in. Staff 3 never
saw the blue vial. The blue vial came up after Youth A returned
from the hospital and Youth A talked to people about it. Youth A
told staff she found a blue vial at a gas station while she was on
her home pass, and it had methamphetamines in it. Staff 3
reported she did not know how Youth A would know it was
methamphetamines in it. Staff 3 had no knowledge or concerns of
any staff members having any drugs on campus and reported she
has never seen any drugs in staff’s cars.
5

Staff 5 was interviewed via teams meeting on 12/13/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 5 was with Youth A at
the festival of lights parade. Youth A grabbed ahold of Staff 5 and
said, “help me” and then collapsed to the ground. Staff 5 helped
Youth A up and got Youth A to a bench to sit down. Youth A was
not responding to questions. Staff 5 asked Youth A if she wanted
to go back to the van and Youth A responded she did. Staff 5
took Youth A back to the van. Youth A continued not responding
to questions Staff 5 was asking. The other youth and staff came
back to the van and on call was called to see what to do. There
was a Sheriff in front of the van at which time staff talked to the
Sheriff and explained what was going on. The Sheriff called for an
ambulance and Youth A was taken to the hospital. All the other
youth got in the van and Youth B made a statement about Youth A
taking heroine. Staff 5 did not see Youth A take anything at the
parade. All the youth in the house were getting ready for the
parade together during the day and no one say anything
concerning. The next day after Youth A returned from the hospital,
Youth A told Staff 5 about a blue vial she had found while on a
home pass at a gas station. Staff 5 never saw the blue vial. Staff
5 did not notice Youth A acting any different in the two weeks
leading up to the festival of lights parade. Staff 5 reported Youth A
told her she took edibles however Youth A provided different
stories of where the edibles came from. Youth A initially said she
took the edibles out of a staff’s coat pocket during the all-staff
Thanksgiving however Youth A did not know whose coat it was.
Youth A then told Staff 5 she got the edibles from a staff’s car on
campus but would not say whose car. Youth A indicated that the
staff’s car was someone she spends a lot of time with and had
gone to a movie with on a facility outing which led to the belief
Youth A was referring to Staff 1. Staff 5 has never seen edibles on
campus either on staff or in staff cars. Staff 5 reported she does
not know what methamphetamines looks like so would not know if
there has ever been any on campus.
Staff 6 was interviewed via teams meeting on 12/19/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 6 had heard about
Youth A however did not have any firsthand knowledge. Staff 6
has never seen staff with any edibles on them or in their cars at
the facility.
Administrator was interviewed via teams meeting on
12/13/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Administrator
reported there have been several stories told about where/how
Youth A obtained edibles and methamphetamine. Administrator
reported Youth A reported to one staff that she obtained the edible
6

from Staff 1’s car. The facility looked into this allegation and
spoke with Staff 1 as well as had Staff 1 drug tested. Staff 1’s
drug test was negative for all substances.
MDHHS worker had no findings in this investigation.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 12/6/2023 and
reported they had no further information.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Incident Report for Youth A dated
11/18/2023: Youth A was at the festive of lights and
asked Staff 2 for help. Youth A dropped to the ground.
Youth A was not able to stand up on her own. Youth A
was unresponsive to staff questions. Staff took Youth A
to the van. Another youth reported Youth A took
heroine. Youth A had an increase heart rate, and her
pupils were enlarged. Youth A was transported via
ambulance to the hospital. Youth A reported she took
meth and got it during her last home pass. Youth A
reported she got edible THC gummies from the
Thanksgiving all staff in a black jacket hanging on a
chair. The gummies were in a blue and green package
that were visible in the pocket when walking out and
grabbed it. Youth A was drug screened and was
positive for THC and a trace of methamphetamines in
her system however the methamphetamines could be
from the medication Youth A is prescribed.
• Eagle Village Drug and Alcohol-Free workplace policy:
Eagle Village is committed to a drug and alcohol-free
work environment that is safe and productive for our
employees, visitors to the workplace and all those
having interactions with our employees. The Eagle
Village drug and alcohol-free workplace policy prohibits
the use of substances restricted under the Federal
Controlled Substances Act, which preempts any
contradictory state or local law. As such, under no
circumstances will marijuana be considered a “legal
drug” under this policy. Use of marijuana is NOT
permitted under this policy even if the marijuana is used
for medical purposes and is permitted under state law.
Employees may not Use or possess or be under the
influence of illegal drugs or unauthorized alcohol on
7

company premises or in the course of business or
during working hours.
• Corewell Health Big Rapids Hospital lab report: Youth A
tested positive for Amphetamines and Cannabinoids.
• Corewell Health Big Rapids Hospital After Care
Summary for Youth A dated 11/18/2023: Reason for
visit was due to altered mental status and Youth A was
diagnosed with drug use.
• Specimen Result Certificate for Staff 1 dated
11/20/2023: Staff 1 was negative for all substances.
• Eagle Village Safety Plan for Youth A dated 11/20/2023:
Youth A was placed on a safety plan as she tested
positive for THC over the weekend resulting in her
home pass being cancelled. Youth A was upset and
AWOLP from the facility and upon returning to the
facility Youth A made statements of self-harm. Youth A
was placed on a safety plan with 10-minute checks as
well as other precautions based on her self-harm
statements.
• Twin Family Medical PC medical document for Youth A:
Youth A is prescribed Adderall XR 30 mg.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had two disciplines
related to following facility policies and procedures to
include leaving the medication cart unlocked and being
on her personal phone during working hours. Staff 1
received training on the facilities policies and
procedures on 4/26/2022.
• Eagle Village documentation of outings from 10/6/2023
through 12/14/2023 that Youth A attended. Youth A
went on twenty-one outings with the facility including
sporting events, parades, movie theater, ice cream,
parks, library, museum, and church. It was not
documented which outings may have included stopping
at a gas station.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews it is unclear where Youth A obtained the edibles. Youth
A reported she found methamphetamines at a gas station
however Youth A’s story regarding both the edibles and
methamphetamines were inconsistent.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility implement a policy for staff vehicles
to be locked when on the facility grounds. It is recommended staff
8

report any concerns or suspicious activity to supervisor on shift as
well as document suspicious/concerning behavior as Youth A
showed Staff 1 the blue vial.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth Restraint; pregnant youth;
Section reduction, prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of
Description restraints.
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth alleged she was placed in an “illegal restraint”.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported she was recently put in an “illegal restraint” at the facility.
Youth A reported she was restrained by Staff 6 after running from
the facility and going out to 175th Road when she was informed
her home passes where being taken away. Youth A reported
Staff 6 restrained her on the road. Youth A slipped out of the
restraint and Staff 3 came to assist. Youth A reported Staff 6 was
on top of her, and she was telling Staff 6 she could not breathe
and to get off her. Youth A asked staff to get her inhaler and staff
did not get it for her as it was in the medication cart at the house.
Youth A reported she had marks on her wrist from Staff 6 digging
in her nails into Youth A’s wrist. Youth A reported Staff 6 was on
one side holding her arm and Staff 7 secured her other arm.
Youth A slipped out of Staff 7’s hold and Staff 6 took over the
restraint. Youth A kicked Staff 6 during the restraint. Staff 3 was
also present. Staff 6 had Youth A restrained on the ground and
was on top of Youth A. Staff 3 was holding Youth A’s arms down
in the supine restraint. Staff 6 was pressing on Youth A’s legs and
stomach with her hands. Youth A described Staff 6 being
between Youth A’s legs on the ground. Staff 7 left while this was
occurring to go back to the house. Police were called by cars
driving past. Youth A told the police Staff 6 was performing an
illegal restraint when they arrived, and the police told Youth A she
looked fine. Youth A reported a youth at another facility died from
a restraint like she was in, and she kept yelling and screaming that
9

she could not breathe and was in an “illegal restraint”. Youth A
reported no other staff were present.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams meeting on 12/13/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 was called for Youth
A leaving the facility grounds after being told she would not be
able to go on her next home pass. Youth A was out on 175th
Road and Staff 6 was following Youth A by walking behind her.
Youth A attempted to assault Staff 6 by kicking Staff 6. Staff 6
blocked the kick. Staff 3 used proximity control to keep Youth A
out of the road. Staff 3 reported Youth A was not restrained
during this incident. When Staff 3 arrived to assist, Youth A
reported she was “illegally restrained” by Staff 6. Youth A was
trying to walk into the road and was making suicidal statements
that she was going to jump in from of traffic. Staff 3 held Youth
A’s wrist while Staff 3 stood closest to the road. Staff 3 reported
Staff 6 and Staff 7 did at one point attempt to restrain Youth A due
to Youth A trying to go into traffic however Staff 3 told Staff 6 and
Staff 7 to release Youth A as Staff 3 has a relationship with Youth
A and felt she could keep her safe. Staff 3 held Youth A’s wrist
and sat on the ground with Youth A. Youth A was sitting on the
ground on her own free will. Youth A tried to role toward traffic.
Staff 3 denied ever hold Youth A’s arm in a supine restraint during
this incident. Staff 3 reported Staff 6 and Staff 7 never had Youth
A in a supine restraint. Youth A was talking about a restraint that
occurred at another facility where a youth was killed. Youth A
never said she could not breathe or requested her inhaler. Staff 6
never had her hand on Youth A’s stomach.
Staff 6 was interviewed via teams meeting on 12/19/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 6 was called as she
was on call the night Youth A left the facility grounds after being
told her home pass was not going to occur. Staff 6 met up with
Staff 7 on 175th Road as Youth A was headed towards US 10.
Youth A was making statements about wanting to die. It was very
dark out and hard to see. Staff 6 and Staff 7 attempted to restrain
Youth A due to Youth A going toward US 10, it being dark, and
Youth A making suicidal statements. The restraint was
unsuccessful as Staff 7 was not able to hook Youth A’s arm. Staff
6 released Youth A’s arm and Staff 6 and Staff 7 used proximity
control. Youth A dropped to the ground on her own and was
laying on her back. Staff 6 denied being on top of Youth A. Youth
A was laying on the ground screaming she was being abused.
Staff 6 reported she was not touching Youth A at any point nor
was anyone else. Staff 6 reported after Staff 7 was unable to
secure Youth A’s arm, no other restraint was initiated. Youth A did
10

kick Staff 6 while Youth A was standing up. Staff 6 was holding
Youth A's wrist when she tried to initiate the restraint and
explained she does have long nails however she did not purposely
dig her nails into Youth A’s wrist. Youth A never made any
statements about Staff 6’s nails hurting her. Staff 6 reported she
never held Youth A’s legs down, she never pressed on Youth A’s
stomach, was never positioned in between Youth A’s legs and
Youth A never asked for her inhaler.
Staff 7 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/16/2024. Staff 7 was called to assist with Youth A when Youth A
went out of bounds. Staff 7 used verbal prompts asking Youth A
to come to the facility. Youth A refused to return to the facility.
Staff 7 reported Youth A was being unsafe as she was getting
closer to US 10, and it was dark out. Staff 7 was concerned with
the traffic on US 10 and Youth A proceeding to move forward
toward the road. Staff 7 asked Staff 6 to assist her as Staff 7 went
in to initiate a two person level one restraint. Staff 7 reported this
was the first restraint she was attempting since working at the
facility and it was unsuccessful. Staff 7 reported she was unable
to secure Youth A’s arm, so Youth A was released by Staff 7 and
Staff 6. Staff 3 came to assist. Staff 7 reported Staff 3 and Staff 6
were able to hold on to Youth A’s arm and sit on the ground with
her in an Aegis safety position. Staff 7 reported she could not
recall details of the restraint. Staff 7 left shortly after Staff 3
arrived and went back to the house. Staff 7 reported she never
saw any staff on top of Youth A. Staff 7 did not recall if Youth A
was having an asthma attack or ever requested her inhaler.
Administrator was interviewed via teams meeting on
12/13/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Administrator
was returning to the facility when Youth A was out on 175th Road
and saw the situation. Administrator reported she saw Youth A
and Staff 3 but could not recall what other staff was present.
Administrator pulled over with her flashers on as Staff 3 was near
the road. Staff 3 let Administrator know that she had the situation
under control, so Administrator left. Administrator reported she
did not see anything concerning during the situation.
Administrator reported it was very dark out and Youth A and Staff
3 were near the road.
MDHHS worker had no findings in this investigation.
The complainant is this consultant as during an interview
with Youth A she reported being put in an “illegal restraint”.
11

Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Incident Report dated 11/21/2023: On
11/20/2023 Youth A went out of bounds and was being
followed by Staff 7. Youth A was making statements that
she wanted to die and was headed toward US 10. It was
dark and hard to see. Youth A was not de-escalating. Staff
6 and Staff 7 were attempting to use proximity control. Staff
6 began to lose proximity control and requested Staff 7’s
assistance and went in to initiate an Aegis level one
restraint. Staff 7 was unable to secure Youth A’s other arm,
so the restraint was unsuccessful, and Youth A was
released. Cars were driving by fast. Youth A was stating
staff could not restrain her as she was not doing anything.
Staff 6 explained to Youth A the safety concern with being
on a dark, busy road at night and Youth A making suicidal
statements.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Therapeutic Holds: When a youth presents an
unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places
the youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs, and all other less restrictive
techniques have been exhausted, an Aegis: Voluntary
Escort/Level One Hold/Level Two/Level Three/Aegis Safety
Position/1 to 1 Benevolent Restraint may be deemed
necessary. It is imperative that staff utilize the two staff
interventions as a primary method of intervening physically,
the 1 to 1 Benevolent Restraint is only for those times when
it is not possible to achieve the two staff intervention.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews with the staff
involved, Youth A was not placed in a restraint as described by
Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149 Resident nutrition.
Section (1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious edible meals
Description daily unless medically contraindicated and documented.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Two youth were denied dinner while on quest.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
12

reported concerns with Youth B and Youth C being denied dinner
while on quest. Youth A reported Youth B and Youth C were
refusing to sit at the table, so staff refused to allow Youth B and
Youth C to eat dinner. Youth A did not recall who the staff were.
Youth A did not recall if Youth B or Youth C were allowed to eat
anything for dinner that night. Youth A reported it was macaroni
and cheese and hot dogs for dinner.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B
reported she has been on one quest while at the facility where
they hiked lake Michigan sand dunes. Youth B reported she and
Youth C were not allowed to eat dinner as they were refusing to
wash a pan. Youth B reported it was macaroni and cheese and
hot dogs. Youth B reported it only happened once and Staff 2 and
Staff 3 were present when it occurred. Staff 3 told Youth B and
Youth C they would get something to eat later, and Staff 2 never
got them anything.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C was
on quest over the summer and was refusing to wash a bowl. Staff
2 refused Youth B and Youth C dinner. Youth C reported it was
macaroni and cheese and hot dogs for dinner. Staff 3 was
present when this occurred. Staff 3 told Youth B and Youth C they
could have peanut butter and jelly for dinner. Youth C and Youth
B were provided with peanut butter and jelly however Youth C
reported it was “soggy”. Youth C reported Staff 4 told Youth B
and Youth C they were not supposed to eat the peanut butter and
jelly sandwiches as they were for lunch. Youth C reported this
was the only time this happened. Youth C reported during this
incident Staff 2 got “in her face” and Youth C yelled at Staff 2.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/12/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth D
